subject: Re: [junit] Testing a method that outputs a text file.

messageBody:
John Miller wrote:
> Hi All,
>
> I've got a class method that writes out a (text) file.
>
> Given a known input how can I test that the output is correct.
>
> I'm using ANT to run my test cases.

Simplest case: write the output to a file, then read it in and check
that you read what you write.

Next: write the output to a file once and check it by hand, then on
subsequent runs, write the output to file and check it against the "Gold
Master" you checked by hand. (Google: gold master keith stobie)

Better design: write text to a PrintWriter, rather than a file. Let your
test write to a PrintWriter wrapping a StringWriter; let you production
code write to a PrintWriter wrapping a FileOutputStream. Your test can
check the string while your production code writes to file.
